embodied vision

awaken your visual sense

Explore your experience of seeing in a gentle, embodied way with Anna Bambridge

Vision

In just opening our eyes we have access to a potentially overwhelming mass of information. What we choose to pay attention to and the awareness that we bring to that process, as individuals and as communities, is significant. With relaxation and movement practices grounded in the Bates method of vision education I invite a deeper awareness of eyesight to help people experience the best of their vision. I work through eyesight but I am aware and interested in how this work affects people physically, emotionally and spiritually. With movement, touch and dialogue I teach how to bring relaxed flexibility into how we use our sense of sight. My aim is to show people that we have choices in how we see. Learning how to look in a relaxed and attentive way can shift the quality of our vision. Through vision work I believe that we can become more aware of ourselves and the world around us. Bringing this awareness into our interactions with our families, communities and our environment can alter our experience of being.

Eyesight Matters in Health

This course is for you if you work with people in a therapeutic or creative way. It is essential learning for yoga teachers, psychotherapists, massage therapists, Feldenkrais practitioners, art therapists, play therapists, somatics practitioners....the list goes on...

The Learning

  • Explore how someone's eyesight impacts body, mind and emotion.
  • Learn about common eyesight challenges from a holistic perspective.
  • Understand simple eyesight prescriptions.
  • What does 20/20 vision really mean? How eyesight is measured.
  • How to integrate eyesight into taking a case study.
  • Why it matters that you know if your client or students wear contact lenses.

The course is online and 6 hours long (you attend both days). The numbers are limited to 8 participants to allow for personal teaching and discussion.

PDF course handout included.

Professional Development Certification available.

I had so much tension in my back. I did lots of yoga and massage but nothing was touching it. Then I started working with my eyesight. It was the magic key to releasing my body and my emotions. Working with my eyesight in tandem with my body and emotional work started the process of transformation I had been seeking.

Anna, Vision Student

Thursday 20th May 2-5pm (BST)

Friday 21st May 2-5pm (BST)

Cost: £90

Bates Method Fundamentals

This workshop is for you if you are interested in natural eyesight improvement. Maybe you are a complete beginner who would like to get some grounding in what eyesight work is all about. Maybe you have had a few lessons or been to a workshop and are interested to find out more. Maybe you have lots of experience but want to get back to basics.

The Learning

The Bates Method is many things. At it's heart is simplicity: the more relaxed we are the more we can see. It is a way to access our own perceptual capacity and can be used in a very practical way for natural eyesight care, as a part of a creative process or as a spiritual practice. In this workshop we will cover the fundamental elements of the Bates Method. We will visit the topics of light, rest, movement, memory and imagination and learn how they relate to the philosophy and practise of this deep and powerful method.

The workshop will consist of presentations, discussion and experiential participation.

Anna’s workshop was a revolution. What she gave me was a paradigm shift in how I think of vision. I was really amazed in the difference in my vision after the workshop. I see space and colour differently. It's a shift in consciousness for me to see seeing by itself for itself as a source of continual nourishment rather than just a pragmatic faculty.

Journeys Into Eyesight Workshop Participant

This is a 6 hour online workshop split over 2 days. The numbers are limited to 8 participants to allow for personal teaching and discussion. The next dates are:

Somatic Seeing

Please join me in my explorations teaching embodied vision education online. These classes are relaxing and perception enhancing, helping you to move into your vision. My aim is that they will feel meditative. The classes will involve some stillness and some gentle movement. Each week we explore a different visual theme, for example, colour, context, texture, depth, details...

The class is drop in, come along when you can.

It was such a treat to really draw attention to my eyes and seeing.

It is a time/space for relaxing, coming into my body, slowing down, and vision is one of the vehicles for this - a sort of body/mind meditation.

Margaret

There is something about the simplicity and gentleness of your work that is deeply moving.  I can’t imagine that it’s just me that ended the class with a feeling of having been taken deep inside to the centre of their being, and wanting to just stay quietly there.

Chris

Next Somatic Seeing class series:

Mondays 1-2pm (BST)

Pay what you can, the suggested price is £10 but it is free if you need it to be.

More Information

One to One

Everyone experiences some variation in their vision throughout life. From slight blurring when ill to severe visual challenges and blindness. Understanding the flexibility of your vision and learning what makes it as clear as possible is a valuable life skill.

One to one sessions allow you to fully explore vision education in a way that is just for you. Using principles and activities rooted in the Bates Method of Vision Education I can guide you to discover different aspects of your eyesight and what might affect your experience of seeing. These sessions are always responsive to your needs and evolve as you learn and grow in confidence with the work.

I teach in person (usually in Glasgow, Scotland) and online.

What I’ve realised is that stress plays a huge factor in how I see. It’s been interesting to see how my vision can change throughout the practises.

Elaine, Artist and Designer

I’ve experienced profound changes in my perception of the world, visually of course, but also in so many other ways. The work goes deep and has touched all parts of my self. Anna’s playful way with the sessions is great – fun and always supportive through this remarkable process.

Alison McGillivray, Musician and Feldenkreis Practitioner

"Thank you for waking me up and waking up my eyes. I just walked home awake to all the colours, shapes, visual vibrancy."

Rosina Bonsu, Yoga Teacher and Dancer

Writing

About Anna

I grew up in Stirling, Scotland with mountains in sight and yellow broom growing in the garden. I had family and cats and a bike. I’d walk to school with my friends. We played in the lanes, climbed trees, stole plums. From the age of three I wore glasses and each year I would visit the optician and my prescription would increase and the lenses in my glasses would thicken slightly. At 18 I went to university in Cambridge, England to study physics. I liked its mathematical elegance and I wanted to understand – to get to the finest subatomic detail, to explore space and time. Still, each year my glasses would get stronger, my lenses thicker.

After graduating I moved to Montreal. My cousins there took me to an optometrist, Abraham Kirshner. This was a pivotal moment for me. “Your glasses are too strong”, he said. No-one had ever said that before. I was always just given stronger ones. But Kirshner was different. He gave me weaker lenses and some relaxation practices to do. My eyesight improved, I was astounded and set on my new path.

Back in Scotland I found my teacher, mentor and support Aileen Whiteford and through her I discovered more about Vision Education and the Bates Method. Through my sessions with her many doors have opened for me and she accompanied me while I explored my natural vision for the first time. She introduced me to Meir Schneider and the many hours that I spent working with the Handbook of Self-Healing he co-wrote with Dror Schneider and Maureen Larkin opened up my body to me bit by bit. Aileen also showed me the International Conference for Holistic Vision. The first time I went was in 1997 in Germany and finding a community of people working with eyesight in a holistic and healing way was another dramatic moment for me.

1997 was also the year that I started at Glasgow Caledonian University Vision Sciences department researching holistic vision therapy. I spent time immersed in the world of optometry and opticians, learning how it all worked. I taught optics and conducted a clinical trial of vision therapy for myopia. It was a time when I had great freedom to pursue my interests but also great restriction in how I could communicate my findings academically. With compromises I graduated in 2001. Throughout this time my vision had been shifting and I had been reducing the strength of my glasses for a time and then not wearing them at all. My vision was very changeable but I was completely in love with the process of change.

After some years working in other fields in rewarding jobs I yielded to the call vision work still had for me. I went back to studying but this time in a practical way at the Bates College of Vision Education with Aileen Whiteford and Margaret Montgomery. I went deeper into the work and learned how to teach it. Since 2007 I have been practising vision education with individual clients and in workshops.

As my vision changed so too did my body and my relationships with everything around me. I did Alexander technique, had cranio-sacral therapy, massage and counselling. I experienced lots of shifts in my body and in my perceptions. For me eyesight work is embodied work and I continue exploring and playing in different ways. I am grateful to all my Contact Improvisation teachers and fellow movers who have given me many tools for expression in relationship. I am also a student of Body-Mind Centring with Embody-Move and I love the open, creative, physical teaching space that provides.

As my vision changed so too did my body and my relationships with everything around me. I did Alexander technique, had cranio-sacral therapy, massage and counselling. I experienced lots of shifts in my body and in my perceptions. I love moving with yoga and dance and these have both been a big part of my personal vision journey. In 2011 I started learning Contact Improvisation and I found that the creativity, clarity, honesty and communication needed to move well in relationship mirrored my experiences with the Bates Method. When the dance worked, so did my eyesight. In 2015 I participated in the New Jammers facilitation training with @The GlasgowJam supported by Creative Scotland. My journey with movement has also led me to study Body-Mind Centring® with Embody-Move.

I am a member of the Bates Association for Vision Education

and the Association of Vision Educators.
